definition: the one who has retreated 50 steps laughs at the one who has retreated 100 steps (idiom)/the pot calls the kettle black
pinyin: wu3 shi2 bu4 xiao4 bai3 bu4

definition: five/5
ten/10
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
surname Bai
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
surname Bu

sentences.english: You don't play basketball better than I do. That is just like the pot calling the kettle black.
sentences.chinese: 你的籃球打得並不比我好，別五十步笑百步了。

sentences.english: Bob's calling him a thief is the same as the pot calling the kettle black.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃說他是小偷，無異於以五十步笑百步。

definition: no better (or worse) than each other/both in the same boat
jackals of the same tribe (idiom); fig. They are all just as bad as each other.
not much to choose between the two/tweedledum and tweedledee
sour grapes (set expr. based on Aesop)/lit. to say grapes are sour when you can't eat them
pinyin: chi1 bu4 dao4 pu2 tao5 shuo1 pu2 tao5 suan1

definition: lit. Dong Shi imitates Xi Shi's frown (idiom)/fig. to mimick sb's idiosyncrasies but make a fool of oneself
it's all very well to talk, but getting things done is another matter (idiom)/to be an armchair expert/to blabber on
pinyin: zhan4 zhe5 shuo1 hua4 bu4 yao1 teng2

definition: lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: to reap what one has sown (idiom)/to stew in one's own juice
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. a thief crying "Stop the thief!" (idiom)/fig. to accuse sb of a theft and try to sneak away oneself/to cover up one's misdeeds by shifting the blame onto others
If you want to condemn sb, don't worry about the pretext (idiom, from Zuozhuan 左傳|左传); one can always trump up a charge against sb/Give a dog a bad name, then hang him.
pinyin: yu4 jia1 zhi1 zui4 , he2 huan4 wu2 ci2

definition: to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
